name: Flanigan's Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We shared the David Pettit Suite with friends. It was better than we expected. plenty of room. You could bring food for breakfast/lunch and store it in the small mini fridge or cooler. Bring plates/ flat wear. They provide a mini coffee pot (friends brought a large one), 4 wine glasses and coffee cups.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our bed was so comfortable we're buying a new one for our home. They had bright lights over our bathroom sink. LOTS of towels and plenty of great EO soap products. Good size patio table on a private porch. The living room was roomy with comfortable couches. WATCH that step up into the kitchen!!! It'll get you. Spotted Dog was very nice as well as The Bit & Spur. Nice and close to the shuttle into the main park. Very clean room and great service. We were all happy with our find. Next time the Villas, they are amazing!
reviews.title: Just right - a must stay at Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hike Angel's Landing, The Narrows and Emerald Pools. Go see Bryce Canyon (if you've never been) and Kodachrome (very close). Beautiful place!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: David Pettite suite was quiet and very private, just above the maze. AND close to the pool!
reviews.title: This place is great! I will definitely go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Were recommended to this place and can see why, great staff, quality establishment, good rooms, nice pool area, and a great restaurant right out front. I would happily stay here again - it was very good value for money and close to everything. If you want the bus to the Park, it stops right outside.
reviews.title: Amazing end to our hiking trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flanigan's Inn was a last minute decision as the hotel we had previously booked seemed a bit far out. We wanted to be close to the Zion National Park and have close access to the shuttle.
reviews.title: Great stay, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The good: The Inn is very convenient as it's located a hop-skip-and-a-jump from Zion National Park entrance. The park shuttle picks up across the street and drops off within feet from the driveway of the hotel. We were given a room in a building close to the road, which made getting to the park that much more convenient. One day we even walked to the park, although, the road is not designed for this and you do have to be careful about traffic. However, it's not a bad walk (maybe 15 minutes) and makes for a great start for the adventures in the Park.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great: The grounds are immaculate. The pool was relaxing and the view could not be beat. The room was large and had a KING size bed. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The Spotted Dog Cafe is within steps from your room and offers a fantastic breakfast at an unbelievable price (was $7.95 for a buffet when I was there). The grouns have a labyrinth and koi pond. The views were outstanding even when you were just standing in the parking lot.
reviews.title: Loved Flanigan's; loved Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bad: We had only planned to stay two nights and wished we had stayed longer!
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having only been in a standard room, I know that we will be getting a deck room when we return to Flanigan's Inn. I think the cost will be well worth.
reviews.title: Immaculate and friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at Flanigan's Inn was a great experience. The location to Zion is hard to beat with places to eat nearby and the Adventure Company right next door. It was fun to see the lizards right outside our door sunning themselves every time we came and went. The bed was one of the most comfortable on our trip and the staff was very friendly. The pool was lovely and the hilltop trail was fun to do at night to get a look at the town. Highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have been going to Flanigans for about 8 years now. I can't say enough about it. Comfy beds, small fridge (for a cold beer at the end of a day of hiking) VERY close to the park. lovely pool and hot tub, laundry facilities and extremely helpful staff. (thanks to Roger and the gang) Lots of shade. Park the car and leave it there. The Spotted Dog restaurant is on the property and is a bit nicer so don't plan on just a burger joint. This was GUUUDDDDD food. There are usually walking sticks to use and a couple of bikes you can borrow if you want. Mint or Rosemary infused water in the lobby to drink as well as coffee any time you'd like. Really we found the best right from the first time we went to Zion and have never looked back.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Springdale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice hotel in great location. easy to get to zion park, short drive to kolob canyon and bryce. good restaurant on site. we spent 6 nights there. room was clean, grounds were nice and well maintained. pool was refreshing.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in early June and used Flanigan's as a base to visit the Park.....took advantage of the shuttle which was so convenient. The weather was extremely hot so we really did not make use of pool area and grounds as ac felt great! Room was comfy and clean.....the lights in the sink area are energy saving area and it always seemed dark. We enjoyed breakfast in The Spotted Dog each morning - inexpensive and a nice buffet. Also had 2 dinners there with nice menu and wine list - a bit expensive tho. We went into town to The Bit and Spur on the middle evening and enjoyed their menu and setting also. Since we had been on the road for about 2 weeks, we enjoyed a rest day here and took a ride out to the West - pretty scenery, and visited some shops in town. I would recommend this Inn while visiting Zion National Park to all.
reviews.title: Location, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our deck overlooked a lovely pond and flowers with a stream. The room was very clean, except for the ants that showed up in the bathroom area after we unpacked. The staff promptly came and sprayed, but the ants continued to show up. We left a note for the area to be sprayed again while we were hiking the next day. Unfortunately, we continued to see them all over the bathroom area. When I checked out, I mentioned them again, but the management did not seem too concerned.
reviews.title: Lovely place, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice surprise! Flanigan's is perfectly situated on the main road in Springdale, across the street from the shuttle stop into Zion.
reviews.title: Lovely and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the first floor overlooking the pond and garden. The room had a Zen-like peacefulness that was relaxing to return to after a hot day of hiking and riding the shuttle. There is a delightful nature trail on the property with a nice view. Wifi was strong from our room and patio.
reviews.title: Perfect Place for visiting Zion National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had 2 issues with the room - the lighting was poor and it always felt dark. We couldn't really leave the curtains open because we were on a busy path on the first floor. Also, we could not get the temperature right - with the AC on we were cold and with it off we were too warm. It would have been nice to be able to open the window.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is always ice lemon water and fresh coffee in the lobby.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel's restaurant, The Spotted Dog, is a great place for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise

description: Located at Zion National Park, Flanigan's Inn is a year-round destination eco-resort and spa designed with a classic park lodge atmosphere.
